metadata.title: CVE-2022-42905 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In wolfSSL before 5.5.2, if callback functions are enabled (via theWOLFSSL_CALLBACKS flag), then a malicious TLS 1.3 client or networkattacker can trigger a buffer over-read on the heap of 5 bytes.(WOLFSSL_CALLBACKS is only intended for debugging.)

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
